Local rickshaws are available. To travel around best option would be to hire a local taxi from any of the travel agents.

value: Sathodi Falls near Yellapur Karnataka as seen on July 2013.

is located at a distance of  25 km from the town of Yellapur. On the outskirts of Yellapura, traveling towards

, is the left turn that leads to Sathodi. Part of the road is an all-weather road but a portion, last 5 km, is a dirt road. Near the end of the rainy season is the best time to visit as the falls will be in full glory and road will be motorable. Using four-wheel drive vehicles or high ground clearance vehicles is recommended for visits during rainy season.

is located just few meters before the falls.

value: Magod Falls near Yellapur, Karnataka as seen on July 2013.

is located 19 km away from Yellapura, in the village of Magodu. From Yellapur, travelling towards
, is the left turn that leads to Magod. Here, the Bedthi river takes two distinct leaps to hurtle from a height of 650 ft. into a rocky ravine. Bedthi river originates from Unkal Lake in

. There is no path to get down to the bottom of the falls.

:Around the falls there are other attractions like, a sunset point called Jenu Kallu Gudda where you can see a beautiful view of the sun set. On the way from Yellapura to Magod falls, there is a lake in the midst of a forest called Kavdi Kere. A temple called Gali Ganapathi 6 km from falls.
There aren't many options available to stay. Best would be to stay in
, which is about 50 km from Yellapur.
